conclusion: The ball is thrown vertically upward with an initial velocity v0 and gravity acts downward.
The vertical position y(t) of the ball is given by y(t) = v0 t - (1/2) g t^2.
The shadow's position on the wall is determined by the geometry of the setup.
Using similar triangles, the shadow's position ys(t) on the wall is ys(t) = 2 y(t).
Substitute y(t) into the equation for ys(t) to get ys(t) = 2 v0 t - g t^2.
The initial velocity of the shadow is the derivative of ys(t) with respect to time t at t = 0, resulting in vs(0) = 2 v0.
The initial velocity of the shadow is 2 v0.
